result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark Edward Wagner was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.  Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program after 3 years is served between this file and 14CF771.

superMiscConds.notes:
**AMENDED 10-29-2015:  Removing DNA surcharge.**
Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: no driving at all!   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol. and controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Mark Edward Wagner in court with attorney Nhu Tran.  Defendant Mark Edward Wagner in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
